conclusion: Analyze forces to find angle θ and coefficient of friction μ.
The image shows a suitcase which can be pushed or pulled.
Gravitational force acts downward, calculated as 150 N.
Normal force acts upward, perpendicular to the ground.
Applied force is 90 N at angle θ above horizontal.
Frictional force acts opposite to motion, f = μN.
Resolve applied force into horizontal and vertical components.
Horizontal component of applied force must balance frictional force.
Vertical component of applied force and normal force must balance gravitational force.
Substitute N from vertical into horizontal equation.
Plug in known values into the equation.
Rearrange equation to solve for μ.
